name: PixelFem #27 - Fatemeh Khanum
description:
Princess Fatemeh Khanum “Esmat al-Dowleh” was the princess of Persia, modern-day Iran. Princess Fatemah was given the responsibility of serving as the host for female foreign guests to the court. She also learned to play the piano and went on to become a photographer with her very own private studio in her home. Her half sister, Zahra, would hold literary salons at her house every week and helped establish The Society of Women’s Freedom, an organization that has been championing Iranian women’s rights since 1910.

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
